P101084.project_name: BO:  Investing in Children and Youth

keywords.cdata: adequate health, basic education, basic education policies, basic health, basic health services, beneficiary households, breastfeeding, cash transfer program, child care, chronic malnutrition, cognitive development, development objectives, Development Planning, economic growth, economic shocks, employment creation, families with children, food consumption, good governance, Government capacity, health services, health system, Human Capital, human development, hygiene, illness, indigenous people, Indigenous Peoples, infant, infant health, institutional capacity, intervention, interventions, labor force, labor market, Malnourished children, malnutrition among children, National Development, National Development Plan, national strategy, nutritional care, nutritional status, poor families, poor households, pregnant women, primary education, primary enrollment, progress, public schools, quality of education, referral system, resource allocation, rural areas, Safeguard policies, sanitation, school age, school age children, school-age children, service providers, skills training, social infrastructure, social programs, social protection, social protection spending, social services, support to families, technical assistance, training programs, unemployment, urban areas, vulnerability, Vulnerable groups, vulnerable households, young children, Youth, youth developmentAAA;adequate health;basic education;basic education policies;basic health;basic health services;beneficiary households;Bo

project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of the Enhancing Human Capital of Children and Youth Project for Bolivia are to : (i) contribute to a reduction in the prevalence of chronic malnutrition in children ages 0-2 years old living in the most vulnerable rural areas of the country; (ii) improve the management and operation of a skills development program for low income youth to enhance its effectiveness in increasing their ability to find and maintain a good quality job; and (iii) improve Government capacity to design and manage a coherent, measurable, and effective social protection network in the medium term. There are three components to the project. The first component consists of implementing and scaling up the Social Protection Program for mothers and children to combat chronic malnutrition; the second component consists of improving and expanding a skills development program for low income unemployed youth living in urban and peri-urban areas and; finally the third component is the institutional strengthening of the Social Protection Network (RPS-DIC). The components will help the Government meet the long-term objective of the RPS-DIC, which is to build a sustainable and integrated social protection system.

P101084.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>ES</LangCode><ProjectName>Bolivia: Invertir en los niños y los jóvenes</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>Los objetivos del Proyecto de inversión en niños y jóvenes para Bolivia son los siguientes: i) contribuir a la reducción de la desnutrición crónica en niños menores de dos años que viven en las zonas rurales más vulnerables del país; ii) mejorar la gestión y el funcionamiento de un programa para el desarrollo de habilidades destinado a jóvenes de ingresos bajos, para que mejoren su eficiencia a la hora de ampliar su capacidad para encontrar y conservar un trabajo de buena calidad, y iii) mejorar la capacidad del Gobierno para diseñar y administrar una red de protección social efectiva, mensurable y coherente a medio plazo. El proyecto consta de tres componentes. El primero se refiere a la puesta en marcha y ampliación del Programa de protección social para madres e hijos, destinado a combatir la desnutrición crónica; el segundo tiene que ver con el mejoramiento y la expansión de un programa de desarrollo de habilidades orientado a jóvenes desempleados de ingresos bajos de zonas urbanas y periurbanas; por último, el tercero se refiere al fortalecimiento institucional de la red de protección social (RPS-DIC). Los componentes ayudarán al Gobierno a cumplir el objetivo a largo plazo de la RPS-DIC, a saber, crear un sistema de protección social sostenible e integrado.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
